Articles.Content:
Fresh install vanilla KSP 1.0.0 (Steam version) running on Windows 7 64bit, using TrackIR 5.2.200:

I start TrackIR 5, then KSP, headtracking in all scenes works fine, BUT:

TrackIR seems to be very insensitive in KSP compared to all other games/sims (DCS, FSX, ArmA III) I use. Although there are sensitivity sliders for 6DOF devices on the right side of the menu (Setting->Input->Other), they are not accessable (greyed out).

I guess this is not intended?

6DOF is for 3D mice like the spaceorb, so won't effect TrackIR anyway, and the settings.cfg only shows "TRACKIR\_ENABLED" for me so I guess there's no sensitivity control.

There's no per-application settings in the TrackIR software?

> 
> 6DOF is for 3D mice like the spaceorb, so won't effect TrackIR anyway, and the settings.cfg only shows "TRACKIR\_ENABLED" for me so I guess there's no sensitivity control.
> There's no per-application settings in the TrackIR software?

Not yet, the TrackIR 5 Software doesn't have KSP in it's list yet, I would have to switch Profiles manually every time. No biggy of course, I just thought the 6DOF camera controls should work for TrackIR.
